an5.179:1.1.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati pañcamattehi upāsakasatehi parivuto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
an5.179:1.1.eng: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika, escorted by around five hundred lay followers, went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side.

an5.179:1.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ āmantesi:
an5.179:1.2.eng: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Sāriputta:

an5.179:1.3.pli: “yaṃ kañci, sāriputta, jāneyyātha gihiṃ odātavasanaṃ pañcasu sikkhāpadesu saṃvutakammantaṃ catunnaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhiṃ akicchalābhiṃ akasiralābhiṃ, so ākaṅkhamāno attanāva attānaṃ byākareyya:
an5.179:1.3.eng: “You should know this, Sāriputta, about those white-clothed laypeople whose actions are restrained in the five precepts, and who get four blissful meditations in this life belonging to the higher mind when they want, without trouble or difficulty. They may, if they wish, declare of themselves:

an5.179:1.4.pli: ‘khīṇanirayomhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇapettivisayo khīṇāpāyaduggativinipāto, sotāpannohamasmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo’ti.
an5.179:1.4.eng: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream-enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am destined for awakening.’

an5.179:2.1.eng: And what are the five precepts in which their actions are restrained?

an5.179:2.2.pli: Idha, sāriputta, ariyasāvako pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti.
an5.179:2.2.eng: It’s when a noble disciple doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.179:2.3.eng: These are the five precepts in which their actions are restrained.

an5.179:3.1.pli: Katamesaṃ catunnaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī?
an5.179:3.1.eng: And what are the four blissful meditations in this life belonging to the higher mind that they get when they want, without trouble or difficulty?

an5.179:3.2.pli: Idha, sāriputta, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:
an5.179:3.2.eng: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha:

an5.179:3.3.pli: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi, satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā’ti.
an5.179:3.3.eng: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those fit for training, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’

an5.179:3.4.pli: Ayamassa paṭhamo ābhicetasiko diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāro adhigato hoti avisuddhassa cittassa visuddhiyā apariyodātassa cittassa pariyodapanāya.
an5.179:3.4.eng: This is the first blissful meditation in this life belonging to the higher mind, which they achieve in order to purify the unpurified mind and cleanse the unclean mind.

an5.179:4.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, sāriputta, ariyasāvako dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:
an5.179:4.1.eng: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the teaching:

an5.179:4.2.pli: ‘svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī’ti.
an5.179:4.2.eng: ‘The teaching is well explained by the Buddha—apparent in the present life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.’

an5.179:4.3.pli: Ayamassa dutiyo ābhicetasiko diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāro adhigato hoti avisuddhassa cittassa visuddhiyā apariyodātassa cittassa pariyodapanāya.
an5.179:4.3.eng: This is the second blissful meditation …

an5.179:5.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, sāriputta, ariyasāvako saṅghe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:
an5.179:5.1.eng: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Saṅgha:

an5.179:5.2.pli: ‘suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho ujuppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho ñāyappaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho sāmīcippaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, yadidaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassā’ti.
an5.179:5.2.eng: ‘The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is practicing the way that’s good, direct, systematic, and proper. It consists of the four pairs, the eight individual persons. This is the Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples that is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.’

an5.179:5.3.pli: Ayamassa tatiyo ābhicetasiko diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāro adhigato hoti avisuddhassa cittassa visuddhiyā apariyodātassa cittassa pariyodapanāya.
an5.179:5.3.eng: This is the third blissful meditation …

an5.179:6.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, sāriputta, ariyasāvako ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti akhaṇḍehi acchiddehi asabalehi akammāsehi bhujissehi viññuppasatthehi aparāmaṭṭhehi samādhisaṃvattanikehi.
an5.179:6.1.eng: Furthermore, a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion.

an5.179:6.2.pli: Ayamassa catuttho ābhicetasiko diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāro adhigato hoti avisuddhassa cittassa visuddhiyā apariyodātassa cittassa pariyodapanāya.
an5.179:6.2.eng: This is the fourth blissful meditation in this life belonging to the higher mind, which they achieve in order to purify the unpurified mind and cleanse the unclean mind.

an5.179:6.3.pli: Imesaṃ catunnaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
an5.179:6.3.eng: These are the four blissful meditations in this life belonging to the higher mind that they get when they want, without trouble or difficulty.

an5.179:7.1.pli: Yaṃ kañci, sāriputta, jāneyyātha gihiṃ odātavasanaṃ—imesu pañcasu sikkhāpadesu saṃvutakammantaṃ, imesañca catunnaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhiṃ akicchalābhiṃ akasiralābhiṃ, so ākaṅkhamāno attanāva attānaṃ byākareyya:
an5.179:7.1.eng: You should know this, Sāriputta, about those white-clothed laypeople whose actions are restrained in the five precepts, and who get four blissful meditations in this life belonging to the higher mind when they want, without trouble or difficulty. They may, if they wish, declare of themselves:

an5.179:7.2.pli: ‘khīṇanirayomhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇapettivisayo khīṇāpāyaduggativinipāto, sotāpannohamasmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo’ti.
an5.179:7.2.eng: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream-enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am destined for awakening.’

an5.179:8.1.eng: Seeing the peril in the hells,

an5.179:8.3.eng: Taking up the teaching of the noble ones,

an5.179:8.4.eng: an astute person should shun them.

an5.179:9.2.eng: so long as strength is found.

an5.179:9.3.eng: Nor should you knowingly speak falsehood,

an5.179:9.4.eng: or take what is not given.

an5.179:10.2.eng: you should stay away from the partners of others.

an5.179:10.3.eng: A personage shouldn’t drink wine or toddy,

an5.179:11.3.eng: You should develop a harmless mind of welfare,

an5.179:11.4.eng: which leads to the realms of gods.

an5.179:12.1.eng: When suitable gifts to give are available

an5.179:12.2.eng: to someone who seeks and needs merit,

an5.179:12.4.eng: if given first to the peaceful ones.

an5.179:13.1.eng: I will tell of the peaceful ones,

an5.179:13.3.eng: Cows may be black or white,

an5.179:14.3.eng: But when one is born among them,

an5.179:15.3.eng: they yoke the load just to him,

an5.179:17.1.eng: but when one is born among them,

an5.179:17.3.eng: Firm in principle, accomplished in ethical conduct,

an5.179:18.1.eng: they’ve given up birth and death,

an5.179:18.2.eng: and have completed the spiritual journey.

an5.179:18.4.eng: they’ve completed the task <j>and are free of defilements.

an5.179:20.3.eng: give their gifts to those outside,

an5.179:20.4.eng: and don’t attend the peaceful ones.

an5.179:21.1.eng: But those who do attend the peaceful ones—

an5.179:21.3.eng: and whose faith in the Holy One

an5.179:22.1.eng: they go to the realm of the gods,

an5.179:22.2.eng: or are born here in a good family.

an5.18:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu parahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no attahitāya.
an5.18:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities is practicing for the welfare of others, but not their own.

an5.18:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu attanā na sīlasampanno hoti, paraṃ sīlasampadāya samādapeti;
an5.18:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant is not personally accomplished in ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, or the knowledge and vision of freedom. But they encourage others in these qualities.

an5.18:1.4.pli: attanā na samādhisampanno hoti, paraṃ samādhisampadāya samādapeti;

an5.18:1.5.pli: attanā na paññāsampanno hoti, paraṃ paññāsampadāya samādapeti;

an5.18:1.6.pli: attanā na vimuttisampanno hoti, paraṃ vimuttisampadāya samādapeti;

an5.18:1.7.pli: attanā na vimuttiñāṇadassanasampanno hoti, paraṃ vimuttiñāṇadassanasampadāya samādapeti.

an5.18:1.8.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu parahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no attahitāyā”ti.
an5.18:1.8.eng: A mendicant with these five qualities is practicing for the welfare of others, but not their own.”

an5.180:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṃ carati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ.
an5.180:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants.

an5.180:1.2.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā addhānamaggappaṭipanno aññatarasmiṃ padese mahantaṃ sālavanaṃ;
an5.180:1.2.eng: While traveling along a road the Buddha saw a large sal grove in a certain spot.

an5.180:1.3.pli: disvāna maggā okkamma yena taṃ sālavanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ sālavanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṃ padese sitaṃ pātvākāsi.
an5.180:1.3.eng: He left the road, went to the sal grove, and plunged deep into it. And at a certain spot he smiled.

an5.180:2.2.pli: “ko nu kho hetu ko paccayo bhagavato sitassa pātukammāya?
an5.180:2.2.eng: “What is the cause, what is the reason why the Buddha smiled?

an5.180:2.3.eng: Realized Ones do not smile for no reason.”

an5.180:2.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an5.180:2.4.eng: So Venerable Ānanda said to the Buddha,

an5.180:2.5.pli: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo bhagavato sitassa pātukammāya?
an5.180:2.5.eng: “What is the cause, what is the reason why the Buddha smiled?

an5.180:2.6.eng: Realized Ones do not smile for no reason.”

an5.180:3.1.pli: “Bhūtapubbaṃ, ānanda, imasmiṃ padese nagaraṃ ahosi iddhañceva phītañca bahujanaṃ ākiṇṇamanussaṃ.
an5.180:3.1.eng: “Once upon a time, Ānanda, there was a city in this spot that was successful and prosperous, populous, full of people.

an5.180:3.2.pli: Taṃ kho panānanda, nagaraṃ kassapo bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho upanissāya vihāsi.
an5.180:3.2.eng: And Kassapa, a blessed one, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, lived supported by that city.

an5.180:3.3.pli: Kassapassa kho panānanda, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa gavesī nāma upāsako ahosi sīlesu aparipūrakārī.
an5.180:3.3.eng: He had a lay follower named Gavesī who had not fulfilled all the precepts.

an5.180:3.4.pli: Gavesinā kho, ānanda, upāsakena pañcamattāni upāsakasatāni paṭidesitāni samādapitāni ahesuṃ sīlesu aparipūrakārino.
an5.180:3.4.eng: And the five hundred lay followers who were taught and advised by Gavesī also had not fulfilled all the precepts.

an5.180:3.5.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, gavesissa upāsakassa etadahosi:

an5.180:3.6.pli: ‘ahaṃ kho imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upāsakasatānaṃ bahūpakāro pubbaṅgamo samādapetā, ahañcamhi sīlesu aparipūrakārī, imāni ca pañca upāsakasatāni sīlesu aparipūrakārino.
an5.180:3.6.eng: ‘I’m the helper, leader, and adviser of these five hundred lay followers, yet neither I nor they have fulfilled the precepts.

an5.180:3.7.eng: We’re the same, I’m in no way better.

an5.180:4.1.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, gavesī upāsako yena tāni pañca upāsakasatāni tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā tāni pañca upāsakasatāni etadavoca:
an5.180:4.1.eng: Then Gavesī went to those five hundred lay followers and said to them:

an5.180:4.2.eng: ‘From this day forth may the venerables remember me as one who has fulfilled the precepts.’

an5.180:4.3.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, tesaṃ pañcannaṃ upāsakasatānaṃ etadahosi:
an5.180:4.3.eng: Then those five hundred lay followers thought:

an5.180:4.4.pli: ‘ayyo kho gavesī amhākaṃ bahūpakāro pubbaṅgamo samādapetā.
an5.180:4.4.eng: ‘Master Gavesī is our helper, leader, and adviser,

an5.180:4.5.pli: Ayyo hi nāma gavesī sīlesu paripūrakārī bhavissati.
an5.180:4.5.eng: and now he will fulfill the precepts.

an5.180:4.6.eng: Why don’t we do the same?’

an5.180:4.7.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, tāni pañca upāsakasatāni yena gavesī upāsako tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā gavesiṃ upāsakaṃ etadavocuṃ:
an5.180:4.7.eng: Then those five hundred lay followers went to Gavesī and said to him:

an5.180:4.8.pli: ‘ajjatagge ayyo gavesī imānipi pañca upāsakasatāni sīlesu paripūrakārino dhāretū’ti.
an5.180:4.8.eng: ‘From this day forth may Master Gavesī remember these five hundred lay followers as having fulfilled the precepts.’

an5.180:4.9.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, gavesissa upāsakassa etadahosi:

an5.180:4.10.pli: ‘ahaṃ kho imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upāsakasatānaṃ bahūpakāro pubbaṅgamo samādapetā, ahañcamhi sīlesu paripūrakārī, imānipi pañca upāsakasatāni sīlesu paripūrakārino.
an5.180:4.10.eng: ‘I’m the helper, leader, and adviser of these five hundred lay followers, and both I and they have fulfilled the precepts.

an5.180:4.11.eng: We’re the same, I’m in no way better.

an5.180:5.1.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, gavesī upāsako yena tāni pañca upāsakasatāni tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā tāni pañca upāsakasatāni etadavoca:
an5.180:5.1.eng: Then Gavesī went to those five hundred lay followers and said to them:

an5.180:5.2.pli: ‘ajjatagge maṃ āyasmanto brahmacāriṃ dhāretha ārācāriṃ virataṃ methunā gāmadhammā’ti.
an5.180:5.2.eng: ‘From this day forth may the venerables remember me as one who is chaste, set apart, avoiding the vulgar act of sex.’

an5.180:5.3.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, tesaṃ pañcannaṃ upāsakasatānaṃ etadahosi:
an5.180:5.3.eng: Then those five hundred lay followers did the same. …

an5.180:5.4.pli: ‘ayyo kho gavesī amhākaṃ bahūpakāro pubbaṅgamo samādapetā.

an5.180:5.5.pli: Ayyo hi nāma gavesī brahmacārī bhavissati ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā.

an5.180:5.7.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, tāni pañca upāsakasatāni yena gavesī upāsako tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā gavesiṃ upāsakaṃ etadavocuṃ:

an5.180:5.8.pli: ‘ajjatagge ayyo gavesī imānipi pañca upāsakasatāni brahmacārino dhāretu ārācārino viratā methunā gāmadhammā’ti.

an5.180:5.9.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, gavesissa upāsakassa etadahosi:

an5.180:5.10.pli: ‘ahaṃ kho imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upāsakasatānaṃ bahūpakāro pubbaṅgamo samādapetā.

an5.180:5.13.pli: Ahañcamhi brahmacārī ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā.

an5.180:5.14.pli: Imānipi pañca upāsakasatāni brahmacārino ārācārino viratā methunā gāmadhammā.
an5.180:5.14.eng: are chaste, set apart, avoiding the vulgar act of sex.

an5.180:5.15.eng: We’re the same, I’m in no way better.

an5.180:6.1.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, gavesī upāsako yena tāni pañca upāsakasatāni tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā tāni pañca upāsakasatāni etadavoca:
an5.180:6.1.eng: Then Gavesī went to those five hundred lay followers and said to them:

an5.180:6.2.pli: ‘ajjatagge maṃ āyasmanto ekabhattikaṃ dhāretha rattūparataṃ virataṃ vikālabhojanā’ti.
an5.180:6.2.eng: ‘From this day forth may the venerables remember me as one who eats in one part of the day, abstaining from eating at night, and from food at the wrong time.’

an5.180:6.3.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, tesaṃ pañcannaṃ upāsakasatānaṃ etadahosi:
an5.180:6.3.eng: Then those five hundred lay followers did the same. …

an5.180:6.5.pli: Ayyo hi nāma gavesī ekabhattiko bhavissati rattūparato virato vikālabhojanā.

an5.180:6.7.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, tāni pañca upāsakasatāni yena gavesī upāsako tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā gavesiṃ upāsakaṃ etadavocuṃ:

an5.180:6.8.pli: ‘ajjatagge ayyo gavesī imānipi pañca upāsakasatāni ekabhattike dhāretu rattūparate virate vikālabhojanā’ti.

an5.180:6.9.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, gavesissa upāsakassa etadahosi:

an5.180:6.10.pli: ‘ahaṃ kho imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upāsakasatānaṃ bahūpakāro pubbaṅgamo samādapetā.

an5.180:6.13.pli: Ahañcamhi brahmacārī ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā.

an5.180:6.14.pli: Imānipi pañca upāsakasatāni brahmacārino ārācārino viratā methunā gāmadhammā.

an5.180:6.16.pli: Imānipi pañca upāsakasatāni ekabhattikā rattūparatā viratā vikālabhojanā.
an5.180:6.16.eng: eat in one part of the day, abstaining from eating at night, and food at the wrong time.

an5.180:6.17.eng: We’re the same, I’m in no way better.

an5.180:7.1.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, gavesī upāsako yena kassapo bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā kassapaṃ bhagavantaṃ arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ etadavoca:
an5.180:7.1.eng: Then the lay follower Gavesī went up to the blessed one Kassapa, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha and said to him:

an5.180:7.2.pli: ‘labheyyāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ labheyyaṃ upasampadan’ti.
an5.180:7.2.eng: ‘Sir, may I receive the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence?’

an5.180:7.3.pli: Alattha kho, ānanda, gavesī upāsako kassapassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjaṃ, alattha upasampadaṃ.
an5.180:7.3.eng: And he received the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence.

an5.180:7.4.pli: Acirūpasampanno kho panānanda, gavesī bhikkhu eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto nacirasseva—yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṃ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
an5.180:7.4.eng: Not long after his ordination, the mendicant Gavesī, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, realized the supreme culmination of the spiritual path in this very life. He lived having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.

an5.180:7.5.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti abbhaññāsi.
an5.180:7.5.eng: He understood: ‘Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is nothing further for this place.’

an5.180:7.6.pli: Aññataro ca panānanda, gavesī bhikkhu arahataṃ ahosi.
an5.180:7.6.eng: And the mendicant Gavesī became one of the perfected.

an5.180:8.1.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, tesaṃ pañcannaṃ upāsakasatānaṃ etadahosi:
an5.180:8.1.eng: Then those five hundred lay followers thought:

an5.180:8.2.pli: ‘ayyo kho gavesī amhākaṃ bahūpakāro pubbaṅgamo samādapetā.
an5.180:8.2.eng: ‘Master Gavesī is our helper, leader, and adviser,

an5.180:8.3.pli: Ayyo hi nāma gavesī kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajissati.
an5.180:8.3.eng: He has shaved off his hair and beard, dressed in ocher robes, and gone forth from the lay life to homelessness.

an5.180:8.4.eng: Why don’t we do the same?’

an5.180:8.5.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, tāni pañca upāsakasatāni yena kassapo bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā kassapaṃ bhagavantaṃ arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ etadavocuṃ:
an5.180:8.5.eng: Then those five hundred lay followers went up to the blessed one Kassapa, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha and said to him:

an5.180:8.6.pli: ‘labheyyāma mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyāma upasampadan’ti.
an5.180:8.6.eng: ‘Sir, may we receive the going forth and ordination in the Buddha’s presence?’

an5.180:8.7.pli: Alabhiṃsu kho, ānanda, tāni pañca upāsakasatāni kassapassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjaṃ, alabhiṃsu upasampadaṃ.
an5.180:8.7.eng: And they did receive the going forth and ordination in the Buddha’s presence.

an5.180:9.1.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, gavesissa bhikkhuno etadahosi:

an5.180:9.2.pli: ‘ahaṃ kho imassa anuttarassa vimuttisukhassa nikāmalābhī homi akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
an5.180:9.2.eng: ‘I get the supreme bliss of freedom whenever I want, without trouble or difficulty.

an5.180:9.3.pli: Aho vatimānipi pañca bhikkhusatāni imassa anuttarassa vimuttisukhassa nikāmalābhino assu akicchalābhino akasiralābhino’ti.
an5.180:9.3.eng: Oh, may these five hundred mendicants do the same!’

an5.180:9.4.pli: Atha kho, ānanda, tāni pañca bhikkhusatāni vūpakaṭṭhā appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharantā nacirasseva—yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṃ—
an5.180:9.4.eng: Then those five hundred mendicants, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, soon realized the supreme culmination of the spiritual path in this very life. They lived having achieved with their own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.

an5.180:9.5.pli: brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihariṃsu.

an5.180:9.6.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti abbhaññiṃsu.
an5.180:9.6.eng: They understood: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’

an5.180:10.1.pli: Iti kho, ānanda, tāni pañca bhikkhusatāni gavesīpamukhāni uttaruttari paṇītapaṇītaṃ vāyamamānā anuttaraṃ vimuttiṃ sacchākaṃsu.
an5.180:10.1.eng: And so, Ānanda, those five hundred mendicants headed by Gavesī, trying to go higher and higher, better and better, realized the supreme bliss of freedom.

an5.180:10.2.eng: So you should train like this:

an5.180:10.3.eng: ‘Trying to go higher and higher, better and better, we will realize the supreme bliss of freedom.’

an5.181:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these five kinds of wilderness dwellers.

an5.181:1.3.pli: Mandattā momūhattā āraññiko hoti, pāpiccho icchāpakato āraññiko hoti, ummādā cittakkhepā āraññiko hoti, vaṇṇitaṃ buddhehi buddhasāvakehīti āraññiko hoti, appicchataṃyeva nissāya santuṭṭhiṃyeva nissāya sallekhaṃyeva nissāya pavivekaṃyeva nissāya idamatthitaṃyeva nissāya āraññiko hoti.
an5.181:1.3.eng: One may be a wilderness dweller because of stupidity and folly. Or because of corrupt wishes, being of wishful temperament. Or because of madness and mental disorder. Or because it is praised by the Buddhas and their disciples. Or for the sake of having few wishes, for the sake of contentment, self-effacement, seclusion, and simplicity.

an5.181:1.4.eng: These are the five kinds of wilderness dwellers.

an5.181:1.5.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ āraññikānaṃ yvāyaṃ āraññiko appicchataṃyeva nissāya santuṭṭhiṃyeva nissāya sallekhaṃyeva nissāya pavivekaṃyeva nissāya idamatthitaṃyeva nissāya āraññiko hoti, ayaṃ imesaṃ pañcannaṃ āraññikānaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro ca.
an5.181:1.5.eng: But the one who dwells in the wilderness for the sake of having few wishes is the foremost, best, chief, highest, and finest of the five.

an5.181:2.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, gavā khīraṃ, khīramhā dadhi, dadhimhā navanītaṃ, navanītamhā sappi, sappimhā sappimaṇḍo, sappimaṇḍo tattha aggamakkhāyati;
an5.181:2.1.eng: From a cow comes milk, from milk comes curds, from curds come butter, from butter comes ghee, and from ghee comes cream of ghee. And the cream of ghee is said to be the best of these.

an5.181:2.2.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, imesaṃ pañcannaṃ āraññikānaṃ yvāyaṃ āraññiko appicchataṃyeva nissāya santuṭṭhiṃyeva nissāya sallekhaṃyeva nissāya pavivekaṃyeva nissāya idamatthitaṃyeva nissāya āraññiko hoti, ayaṃ imesaṃ pañcannaṃ āraññikānaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro cā”ti.
an5.181:2.2.eng: In the same way, the one who dwells in the wilderness for the sake of having few wishes is the foremost, best, chief, highest, and finest of the five.”

an5.182:1.3.pli: Mandattā momūhattā paṃsukūliko hoti …pe… idamatthitaṃyeva nissāya paṃsukūliko hoti.
an5.182:1.3.eng: One may wear rag robes because of stupidity … corrupt wishes … madness … because it is praised by the Buddhas … or for the sake of having few wishes …

an5.182:1.4.eng: These are the five who wear rag robes.”

an5.183:0.3.eng: Dwelling at the Root of a Tree

an5.183:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these five who dwell at the root of a tree.

an5.183:1.3.pli: Mandattā momūhattā rukkhamūliko hoti …pe… idamatthitaṃyeva nissāya rukkhamūliko hoti.
an5.183:1.3.eng: One may dwell at the root of a tree because of stupidity … corrupt wishes … madness … because it is praised by the Buddhas … or for the sake of having few wishes …

an5.183:1.4.eng: These are the five who dwell at the root of a tree.”

an5.184:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these five dwell in a charnel ground.

an5.184:1.3.pli: Mandattā momūhattā sosāniko hoti …pe… idamatthitaṃyeva nissāya sosāniko hoti.
an5.184:1.3.eng: One may dwell in a charnel ground because of stupidity … corrupt wishes … madness … because it is praised by the Buddhas … or for the sake of having few wishes …

an5.184:1.4.eng: These are the five who dwell in a charnel ground.”

an5.185:1.1.eng: “These five dwell in the open air. …”

an5.187:0.3.eng: Those Who Sleep Wherever a Mat is Laid

an5.187:1.1.eng: “These five sleep wherever they lay their mat. …”

an5.188:0.3.eng: Those Who Eat in One Sitting

an5.188:1.1.eng: “These five eat in one sitting per day. …”

an5.189:1.1.eng: “These five refuse to accept food offered after the meal has begun. …”

an5.19:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu neva attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya.
an5.19:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities is practicing neither for their own welfare, nor that of others.

an5.19:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu attanā na sīlasampanno hoti, no paraṃ sīlasampadāya samādapeti;
an5.19:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant is not personally accomplished in ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, or the knowledge and vision of freedom. Nor do they encourage others in these qualities.

an5.19:1.4.pli: attanā na samādhisampanno hoti, no paraṃ samādhisampadāya samādapeti;

an5.19:1.5.pli: attanā na paññāsampanno hoti, no paraṃ paññāsampadāya samādapeti;

an5.19:1.6.pli: attanā na vimuttisampanno hoti, no paraṃ vimuttisampadāya samādapeti;

an5.19:1.7.pli: attanā na vimuttiñāṇadassanasampanno hoti, no paraṃ vimuttiñāṇadassanasampadāya samādapeti.

an5.19:1.8.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu neva attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāyā”ti.
an5.19:1.8.eng: A mendicant with these five qualities is practicing neither for their own welfare, nor that of others.”
